title: Nicholas Jenson
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Designers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Designers) : Nicholas Jenson**

Typefounder, born [1420](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/1420) in [France](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/France).

During the [1450s](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/1450s), [Charles VII](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Charles%20VII) sent Nicholas Jenson to [Mainz](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Mainz), [Germany](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Germany) to learn the art of printing. There he became an apprentice to [Johann Gutenberg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Johann%20Gutenberg).

After a nasty civil war in [1462](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/1462), most of Mainz's printers left the city. Many of them travelled to [Italy](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Italy), including Jenson—who ended up in [Venice](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Venice) before [1470](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/1470). There, he cast his famous type, which might be the first non- [blackletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/blackletter) type ever cast in the west.

Jenson died in [Rome](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Rome) in [1480](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/1480).

Most typefaces that are named after Jenson bear little or no relation to his work. However, [Bruce Rogers](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Bruce%20Rogers)' [Centaur](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008025753/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Centaur) comes very close to capturing its spirit.
author: dan_reynolds
